introduction:
• To improve the learning experience in the course 'engineering physics' through interactive simulations
  • To improve the key laboratory skills and essential non-cognitive Skill
  • To develop the virtual experiments as supplementary educational tools which will be efficient in enhancing learning and self-efficacy of the user.
  • To develop the virtual experiments as a feasible tool of assessment and explanatory feedback

experiments.name: Newton’s ring experiment: to determine the wavelength of light
Diffraction grating to determine the wavelength of laser
Laurentz half shade polarimeter: To determine the specific rotation of optically active substance
Geiger Muller counter: To determine the optimum operating voltage and dead time of Geiger Muller tube
Energy band gap of a semiconductor
To Study The Characteristics Of Solar Cell
To determine the Planck's constant from kinetic energy versus frequency graph
Measurement of Planck’s constant through Black Body Radiation
Determination of ultrasonic waves velocity in liquid media
Determination of Hall voltage, and Hall coefficient in Hall effect set up

objective:
• To improve the learning experience in the course 'engineering physics' through interactive simulations.
  • To improve the key laboratory skills and essential non-cognitive Skill.
  • To develop the virtual experiments as supplementary educational tools which will be efficient in enhancing learning and self-efficacy of the user.
  • To develop the virtual experiments as a feasible tool of assessment and explanatory feedback.

courseAlignment.description: The syllabi of this lab aligns to the following universities in India.
universities: BSC 102 - Laboratory - Oscillations, waves and optics
Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Marathwada University, Aurangabad, Maharashtra; Engineering Physics; Common to all first year students
Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Technical University, Lonere, Maharashtra; Engineering Physics; Common to all first year students
Savitribai phule pune university, engineering physics, Common to all first year students
University of Mumbai university, engineering physics, first year engineering
